datasets.name: 903453bc
46e6f6b7
queryLines:
USE CATALOG `workspace`;
USE SCHEMA `default`;

--This question told total profit each by by data story by sales_amount is total_price & price is price that products per piece
SELECT *,
  CONCAT(ROUND((total_profit/total_cost)*100,2), ' %') AS percentage
FROM(
  SELECT date_trunc('month', order_date)::DATE AS order_dates,
    SUM(sales_amount) AS total_prices,
    SUM(quantity * cost) AS total_cost,
    (SUM(sales_amount) - SUM(quantity * cost)) AS total_profit
  FROM workspace.salesdb.fact_sales
  JOIN workspace.salesdb.dim_products ON  
    dim_products.product_key = fact_sales.product_key
  GROUP BY 1
) t
ORDER BY order_dates

queryLines:
USE CATALOG `workspace`;
USE SCHEMA `default`;

--This question told total profit each by by data story by sales_amount is total_price & price is price that products per piece
SELECT SUM(sales_amount) AS total_prices,
  SUM(quantity * cost) AS total_cost,
  (SUM(sales_amount) - SUM(quantity * cost)) AS total_profit
FROM workspace.salesdb.fact_sales
JOIN workspace.salesdb.dim_products ON  
  dim_products.product_key = fact_sales.product_key

datasets.name: 913ccf28
4cbae8d8
datasets.displayName: Number of orders by customer age group
queryLines:
USE CATALOG `workspace`;
USE SCHEMA `default`;

--This query show about Number of orders by customer age group
--This query show about Number of orders by customer age group
SELECT 
  CASE
    WHEN date_diff(year, birthdate, current_date()) < 20 THEN 'Under 20'
    WHEN date_diff(year, birthdate, current_date()) BETWEEN 20 AND 30 THEN '20-30'
    WHEN date_diff(year, birthdate, current_date()) BETWEEN 30 AND 40 THEN '30-40'
    WHEN date_diff(year, birthdate, current_date()) BETWEEN 40 AND 50 THEN '40-50'
    WHEN date_diff(year, birthdate, current_date()) BETWEEN 50 AND 60 THEN '50-60'
    ELSE '60+'
    END AS age_group,
  COUNT(DISTINCT order_number) AS number_of_orders
FROM workspace.salesdb.dim_customers
JOIN workspace.salesdb.fact_sales ON
  fact_sales.customer_key = dim_customers.customer_key
GROUP BY 1
ORDER BY 1;

datasets.name: 580e4ce2
queryLines:
USE CATALOG `workspace`;
USE SCHEMA `default`;

--This query wanna show Top 10 customer by sales, that's mean most top 10 users as bought
SELECT customer_number,
  SUM(sales_amount) AS total_sales
FROM workspace.salesdb.dim_customers
JOIN workspace.salesdb.fact_sales ON
  workspace.salesdb.dim_customers.customer_key = workspace.salesdb.fact_sales.customer_key
GROUP BY 1
ORDER BY 2 DESC
LIMIT 10;

datasets.name: 1b96f680
c114f7e0
847a6b46
916fbf33
queryLines:
USE CATALOG `workspace`;
USE SCHEMA `salesdb`;

--this query for seperate customer group by spending by we assume 
--if our customer spent more than 4000$ -> VIP PLATINUM
--if our customer spent between 3000$ - 3999$ -> VIP GOLD
--if our customer spent between 2000$ - 2999$ -> VIP SILVER
--if our customer spent between 1000$ - 1999$ -> VIP BRONZE
--if our customer spent less than 1000$ -> STANDARD
--and show how many customer in each group
SELECT customer_tier,
  COUNT(customer_number) AS number_of_customer
FROM (
  SELECT customer_number,
    SUM(sales_amount) AS Total_Spent,
    CASE
      WHEN SUM(sales_amount) >= 4000 THEN 'VIP PLATINUM'
      WHEN SUM(sales_amount) BETWEEN 3000 AND 3999 THEN 'VIP GOLD'
      WHEN SUM(sales_amount) BETWEEN 2000 AND 2999 THEN 'VIP SILVER'
      ELSE 'VIP BRONZE'
    END AS customer_tier
  FROM workspace.salesdb.dim_customers
  JOIN workspace.salesdb.fact_sales ON
    workspace.salesdb.dim_customers.customer_key = workspace.salesdb.fact_sales.customer_key
  GROUP BY 1
)
GROUP BY 1
ORDER BY 
  CASE
    WHEN customer_tier = 'VIP PLATINUM' THEN 1
    WHEN customer_tier = 'VIP GOLD' THEN 2
    WHEN customer_tier = 'VIP SILVER' THEN 3
    ELSE 4
  END DESC
